MachineInfo.OrderComment:
Contract ID: 6651 Option D: Point to Point Pre-Drill Single 23,000 RPM spindle drill unit with quick change chuck. Programmed motion drills pilot holes in succession for hinge or lock face plate screws.
Option I: Deep Drill Capability Computer controlled deep drill will be mounted to the travelling head of the EDGE-SS to automatically drill a 21/32" diameter hole for concealed rods and flush bolts up to 24" deep. Positioning from the edge of the door to the center of the hole and the depth of the hole will be done with dimension entries on the computer. Programmable Y axis for door thickness is not available on this head, so door thickness selections are limited to two settings within the sofware, typically for 1-3/4" and 2-1/4" doors.
Option J: Squaring Chisels for Lock Face Plates Four chisels, one for each corner latch plate mortise and hinge pockets. The correct chisel is selected for each corner and the depth of the plunge is set based on the machined depth of the mortise.
Option R: 3 HP Spindle Router for Hinges and Face-Plates Adds a fourth high frequency routing spindle with a short shank 1/2" diameter tool optimized for cutting face-plates or hinges up to 0.250" deep. This is an ideal head for diamond tooling and will speed up cycle rates for these popular sequences.

Option Custom Input Control: Inputs will be provided to connect with Midwest's computer download to automatically select one of three screw colors.
Option: Reverse Orientation: All connections with electrical, air and screw hoses are reversed. This station is positioned to right of the 990FX standing along the hinge side.

Option C: Pushbutton Selection for Face Bore Backsets For two face bore backsets between 2-3/8� and 2-3/4�. Manual adjustment takes 5 to 10 minutes.
Option N: Dust Blow off System Air blow-off tube cleans dust and chips from the top of a door.
Option T: High-Frequency Hinge Routers Three 1 HP 230/380v high-frequency hinge routers and drive units with 1/2" collet.
Option U: High-Frequency Bolt Plate Router One 1 HP 230/380v high-frequency bolt plate router with drive unit and 1/2" collet.
Option S: 6'8" and 7'0" Lock Postion Stops Air operated stops, on for left hand doors and one for right hand doors will be installed. The stops will be controlled by a valve mounted on the hinge side of the 990FX where the operator can reach it without leaving his work station. NOTE: With this quick change option for the lock bore location only two locations for both right hand and left hand are allowed, and must be specified at the time the machine is ordered.
Option: Dust Hoods Beween Door and Jamb: Replaces standard chip-out block system
Option: Jamb Pushers Like the Shelby lines, the jamb indexing system must accommodate split jambs with a turret on the end pushers.
Special Inputs and Programming for Download Control Special Inputs include: >Face Bore (y,n) > Face Bore (2-3/8, 2-3/4) Face Bore Depth (shallow, deep) > Face Plate (y,n) > Latch Bore (y,n) > Pre-drill (y,n) > Screwdriver (y,n) > 2, or 3 hinges > LH/RH > 6’8” or 7’0” lock bore position
Special Notes: Jamb pusher and stop to be welded to the tube. Jamb positioning stop requires manual adjustment on existing lines for 7'0" jambs. It is too time consuming. A simple method with an over-ride switch or quick adjustment without tools is required on this line.
Reverse Feed: Feed Direction is right to left standing at the hinge routers.
Option: Reverse Feed Reverses the jamb transfer system for right hand to left hand feed direction standing at the hinge side of the 990FX.

VFD Upgrade: Upgrades the conveyor roll drives to VFD's allowing smooth start and stops at 150FPM matching the speed of the 990FX.
Reverse Feed Direction: Feed direction is right to left standing on the hinge side of the 990FX

Contract ID: 6427 The RTS-FX is companion station for the 990FX allowing up to three sets of screw hoppers to automatically index for screw color change.
It includes a custom framework designed to fit around above Midwest's existing door transfer conveyor.
Above the existing conveyor table, a four sided “Lazy Susan” supported on heavy duty Timken bearings and framework, will allow up to three sets of screw hoppers to rotary index in 90 degree increments with a servo motor and gear system. Screw feed hoses (18) from the 990FX screw drivers are arranged to connect to a manifold below the screw hoppers, and in alignment with the hinge side of the 990FX. Screws drop by gravity from the hoppers down into the manifold, and are blown with compressed air up to the screwdrivers.
Screws can be easily reloaded into the hoppers when rotated in alignment with the hinge side of the 990FX. Changing the screw color will be via pushbutton, or via automatic download from Midwest’s door data. Rotation time is estimated at 4-5 seconds.
Price includes moving the three standard screw hoppers from above the 990FX to this station, along with six more hoppers.
Custom Input Control: Inputs will be provided to connect with Midwest's computer download to automatically select one of three screw colors.

Contract ID:6427 Option C: Pushbutton Selection for Face Bore Backsets For two face bore backsets between 2-3/8� and 2-3/4�. Manual adjustment takes 5 to 10 minutes.
Option N: Dust Blow off System Air blow-off tube cleans dust and chips from the top of a door.
Option T: High-Frequency Hinge Routers Three 1 HP 230/380v high-frequency hinge routers and drive units with 1/2" collet.
Option U: High-Frequency Bolt Plate Router One 1 HP 230/380v high-frequency bolt plate router with drive unit and 1/2" collet.
Option S: 6'8" and 7'0" Lock Postion Stops: Air operated stops, on for left hand doors and one for right hand doors will be installed. The stops will be controlled by a valve mounted on the hinge side of the 990FX where the operator can reach it without leaving his work station. NOTE: With this quick change option for the lock bore location only two locations for both right hand and left hand are allowed, and must be specified at the time the machine is ordered.
Dust Hoods Between Door & Jamb: Replaces standard chip-out block system
Jamb Pushers: Like the Shelby lines, the jamb indexing system must accommodate split jambs with a turret on the end pushers.
Special Notes Jamb pusher and stop to be welded to the tube. Jamb positioning stop requires manual adjustment on existing lines for 7'0" jambs. It is too time consuming. A simple method with an over-ride switch or quick adjustment without tools is required on this line.
Special Inputs and Programming for Download Control: Special Inputs include: >Face Bore (y,n) > Face Bore (2-3/8, 2-3/4) > Face Bore Depth (shallow, deep) > Face Plate (y,n) > Latch Bore (y,n) > Pre-drill (y,n) > Screwdriver (y,n) > 2, or 3 hinges > LH/RH > 6’8” or 7’0” lock bore position
Ball Catch Drilling: Drill assemblies are mounted onto the lock boring section for drilling left hand and right hand doors for drive-in ball catches. When selected the proper drill automatically pivots in to drill into the top of the door. Note: minimum door width is 18" for drilling. Automatic on/off and door hand can be manually selected and an extra input will be provided for automatic activation via Midwest control system.
Contract ID: 6427
Contract ID:6427 VFD Upgrade: Upgrades the conveyor roll drives to VFD's allowing smooth start and stops at 150FPM matching the speed of the 990FX.

Option B: Automatic Door Rotate Adds rotate capability to the vacuum lifting fixture so doors can rotate 180 degrees as they transfer to the infeed table, or door stack. Touch screen programming is included to rotate every door, every other door or one door. PLC inputs are also available to automatically rotate as part of a down-load process.

Option BC: Bar Code Scanning Hand held bar code reader with flexible cable, including software installed on the FACE-SS, for scanning door as it enters the machine. Note: doors must be properly stacked for left hand or right hand if the option for the automatic rotate system, option B, on the Vision Door Feeder/Door stacker is not selected.
The hand held scanner may also be used to read the bar code on doors that are manually loaded or for a door that did not automatically scan.
Adds face plate and latch bore capability for 161 style lock preps, including corner squaring and either 0 or 3 degree face plate routing. Total cycle for face holes, square face plate and latch bore is approximately 55 seconds. Plate size and depth is programmable but limited to 1-1/4" x 2-1/2" and centered on the lock face hole. Latch bore depth is limited to 2-1/4" from the door edge, or adequate for 2-3/4" backset locks. Mechanism includes additional 3HP spindle router positioned horizontally and adjacent to the existing face routers, which telescopes upwards to center on the door edge during face plate/latch-bore operation. Chisels are positioned on the same plate.
A quotation for recommended spare parts for the machine will be provided based on your access to parts locally and your need to keep down time at a minimum. Please review with your KVAL consultant to determine your needs.

Option D: Point to Point Pre-Drill Single 23,000 RPM spindle drill unit with quick change chuck. Programmed motion drills pilot holes in succession for hinge or lock face plate screws.
Option DA: Door Position Animation Door Position Animation Screen includes programming and extra video display showing an animation to graphically indicate how to position the door in the EDGE. Information for the display is automatically generated based on information contained in the door file program. The sequence is optimized based on door swing and hardware details to minimize operator steps. The screen updates after each operation to show the next step, and indicates the last step. When the EDGE is equipped with option Q, Power Off-Feed it will automatically unclamp and feed the door to the next machine when it is ready to receive the door. This allows the operator to return to the FACE and begin to process the next door.
Option I: Deep Drill Capability Computer controlled deep drill will be mounted to the travelling head of the EDGE-SS to automatically drill a 21/32" diameter hole for concealed rods and flush bolts up to 24" deep. Positioning from the edge of the door to the center of the hole and the depth of the hole will be done with dimension entries on the computer. Programmable Y axis for door thickness is not available on this head, so door thickness selections are limited to two settings within the sofware, typically for 1-3/4" and 2-1/4" doors.
Option J: Squaring Chisels for Lock Face Plates Four chisels, one for each corner latch plate mortise and hinge pockets. The correct chisel is selected for each corner and the depth of the plunge is set based on the machined depth of the mortise.
Option Q: Power Off-feed Powered out feed rolls positioned in the table will automatically start after the door machining has been completed and the caster bed lowers the door onto the door onto the rolls. The door will automatically feed out only when the next machine is ready to receive the door. A switch is included for the operator to enable the sequence when the door is clamped on the "Last Edge". This allows the operator to return to the FACE-SS to begin machining the next door without delay or further intervention.
Option R: 3 HP Spindle Router for Hinges and Face-Plates Adds a fourth high frequency routing spindle with a short shank 1/2" diameter tool optimized for cutting face-plates or hinges up to 0.250" deep. This is an ideal head for diamond tooling and will speed up cycle rates for these popular sequences.
Option: Spare Parts Package Includes spare parts for all three machines including both mechanical and electrical components: Quote ID 20327.

Contract: 5843 Reverse Feed and Stack Reverse Feed Direction. Doors feed from right to left standing on the hinge side with the door stack also on the hinge side.
Upgrade Vacuum Cup Thickness Schmalz vacuum lifting beams will be equipped with 30mm thick foam to conform around proud door mouldings. Confirm part Schmalz part number of 10.01.21.02300/2
Door Stack Chain Conveyor $24,950.00 Includes dual chain conveyor system allowing a new door stack to be positioned outside the main feeder framework for immediate in-feed when required. The chains also extend under the feeder's power conveyor table to also convey caul boards towards the hinge side of 990HB just above for the floor for restacking. The conveyor chain is jogged by the operator holding down an electric foot-pedal. A set of stack position eyes are mounted at the conveyor table to stop the chain, until the pedal is released and pressed again.
The design includes 4" tall bumpers above the chain on the outer end. A lift driver lowers a new stack to just above the chain, then backs up to align the stack against the bumpers before lowering to the chain. This aligns the stack for in-feed up to the conveyor table.
Two vertical light curtains will also be provided to allow the feeder to remain operating while a new stack is loaded on the conveyor chains. The inner light curtain is a full emergency stop, while the outer curtain, spaced 14" further, pauses the vacuum platen travel. The inner curtain will be positioned approximately 2" past a 42" door stack.

Contract: 5843 Reverse Feed and Stack Reverse Feed Direction. Doors feed from right to left standing on the hinge side with the door stack also on the hinge side.
Upgrade Vacuum Cup Thickness Schmalz vacuum lifting beams will be equipped with 30mm thick foam to conform around proud door mouldings. Confirm part Schmalz part number of 10.01.21.02300/2
Door Stack Chain Conveyor $24,950.00 Includes dual chain conveyor system allowing a new door stack to be positioned outside the main feeder framework for immediate in-feed when required. The chains also extend under the feeder's power conveyor table to also convey caul boards towards the hinge side of 990HB just above for the floor for restacking. The conveyor chain is jogged by the operator holding down an electric foot-pedal. A set of stack position eyes are mounted at the conveyor table to stop the chain, until the pedal is released and pressed again.
The design includes 4" tall bumpers above the chain on the outer end. A lift driver lowers a new stack to just above the chain, then backs up to align the stack against the bumpers before lowering to the chain. This aligns the stack for in-feed up to the conveyor table.
Two vertical light curtains will also be provided to allow the feeder to remain operating while a new stack is loaded on the conveyor chains. The inner light curtain is a full emergency stop, while the outer curtain, spaced 14" further, pauses the vacuum platen travel. The inner curtain will be positioned approximately 2" past a 42" door stack.

Touch Screen Integration All touch screen functions will be integrated into the 990HB touch screen, mounted on left end of the 990HB and adjacent to an independent touch screen for the door feeder. Extended Safety Fence
Extended Safety Fence Safety fence to be extended from the frame of the ON12 to the frame of the quick change screw bin holder.
Reverse feed doors from right to left. Involves completely custom run of mirrored parts.

Addional Three Quick Change Screw Hoppers Adds an extra bank of screw feed hoppers with quick screw change capability, also mounted to the same framework above the 558 door feeder. This allows screw color changes or reloading while the 990HB is operating. A materials operator could monitor upcoming doors and load the new screw color while a second operator continues to run the machine. A touch screen selection will switch between hopper banks in about one second.
Lever Lock Screw Hole Drills Adds drill cartridge system to drill screw holes for lever locks during the lock processing sequence. No cycle time impacts. Includes two drill boxes, for Sargent 4375C and Schlage D Series #792. Minimum door width for lever lock hole processing and standard locks is 18. Please note, drill cartridge units will be custom engineered to fit and are not interchangeable with other Kval door machines.
Ball Catch Drills Drill assemblies are mounted onto the lock boring section for drilling left hand and right hand doors for drive-in ball catches. When selected the proper drill automatically pivots in to drill into the top of the door. Note: minimum door width is 18 for drilling.
Option for lever lock holes will include only the Schlage D series drill unit rather than two units. Price is adjust accordingly.
Reverse Feed Direction: Reverse feed doors from right to left.

Contract: 5843 Option C: Jamb Width Auto Selector Enables easy switching for jamb widths between 4-9/16 In, 5-1/4 In, 6-9/16 In, and 7-1/4 In.
Option G: 7 Ft Door Frame Capacity Allow Operator to quickly adjust end clamps from 6 Ft 8 Inch to 7 Ft doors. Quick changeover time of approximately one minute required.
In-feed and out-feed ends reversed for right to left door processing standing at the hinge side of door units.
Includes up to 60 hours of programming to automatically set-up the machines described in this quote. The set-ups are based on a data transferred when RFID chips are scanned at the door feeder. The automatic settings will include at least: 1) Door Size 2) Bevel 3 degree, O degree or feed thru (feed thru for all prefinish complete door, flush HC & SC stock doors, SO flush?, 1-3/4” flush stock doors) 3) Hinge pattern (size, radius) a. Size = 3-1/2”, 4” or 5” b. Radius = 5/8”, ¼” or square 4) Screw color 5) Door handing (LH, RH) 6) Door thickness 7) Door height 8) 3 degree or square 9) Quanity of lock bores (up to 3) 10) Location of lock bores 11) Face plate routine (size, radius or square) 12) Lock backset 13) Lock bore type (cylindrical or A.L. prep) 14) Lock bore depth (thru, or not) 15) Double door or single door 16) Ball catch or not 17) Jamb width
Programming will also be provided to send back a signal showing receipt of data and to edit screw location edits. Manual over-rides for missing data will be provided at each station - just like standard Kval stations. Error recovery for doors removed or inserted is also included.
Bayer Built agrees to provide scanner(s) for the feeder which Kval will mount and test.
Move the operator control panel and foot-pedal to the fixed side, in line with the 990HB hinge routers.

Option A: Reverse Stack In a pre-hanging operation this places the stack of doors on the operator side of a Commander or F-Series machine.
Option H: Remote Switch for Manual Feed Through Allows doors to be fed manually from the end of the machine. Price includes a non marking plastic roll mounted in the guard.
Option L: Ability to Feed Doors With Raised Molding This option adds the capacity to feed doors with raised molding on either or both sides. Maximum molding height above door face will be 3/4 inch. Spacers used to stack doors must be postioned so they do not interfere with the clamp system. The clamp system supports must be manually positioned to clear the molding prior to feeding the doors. The feed table will be equipped with additional rubber covered rolls closely spaced to support the door on the molding. NOTE: If ON-3 is used to feed a 555 Door Sizer Option R: Powered in-feed extension is required.
Option T: Extended Control Cable Option T: Extended Control Cable Extended cable length required when the 558 Door Sizer is included in the pre-hanging line so the control panel for the ON-3 can be mounted next to the door pre-hanging machine control panel. NOTE: This option is required when the 558 Door Sizer is installed between the ON-3 and the door pre-hanging machine.
Option: Tooling and Lubrication Package Please review with your KVAL Consultant to determine your needs.

Contract ID:6466 Option R: Raised Moulding Infeed Width adjust powered extension mounted on the in-feed end of the 558. Provides the capacity to accommodate doors with raised molding. NOTE: Required when a Handler or ON-3 is used to feed doors with raised molding into the 558.

MachineInfo.Description: 994-X: SERVO CONTROLLED DOOR PRE HANGING MACHINE
MachineInfo.OrderComment:
Contract ID:6466 Option A: Six-Shooter Screw Gun for 3-1/2" X 3-1/2" Hinge To attach 3-1/2" X 3-1/2" hinges to the door and jamb, No. 9 by 3/4" long flat head screws are automatically sorted and fed, six at a time, to the screw gun. Operator manually places the hinge onto the magnetic indexing fixture and then rolls and pivots the Six Shooter into an "H" block at each hinge location to attach the hinges. Pressing the 'Reset' switch then raises the Six Shooter and feeds a set of six screws for the attachment of the next hinge. NOTE: Requires Option D: Pre-Drill System for Six Shooter.
The Six Shooter, which is supported on ball bearing equipped steel wheels, is mounted on an overhead track that is precisely aligned to ensure the hinge is properly position into the pocket at each hinge location.
NOTE: When an Eight Shooter Screw Gun is added to a 990F-3 (or 990F-4) equipped with a Six Shooter, the overhead track system must be extended in length on both ends to provide the necessary clearance for hinge applicator being used to travel the full length of the track to attach the hinges without having to move the door and jamb.
Option BC: Ball Catch Drills Drill assemblies are mounted onto the lock boring section for drilling left hand and right hand doors for drive-in ball catches. When selected the proper drill automatically pivots in to drill into the top of the door. Note, minimum door width for drilling is 18".
Option CH: Corner Square Chisels Corner Square Option adds automatic corner squaring to the hinge routing sequence in both the door and jamb. Option includes two chisel mounting blocks per head, each one containing two chisels. As one chisel is operating, the inactive chisel is in the reveal between the door and jamb. For instance, when you are squaring the upper right corner in the jamb, the lower right chisel will be in the reveal. When the lower right chisel is squaring the lower right corner in the door, the upper right chisels in in the reveal. Although two chisels are paired together in one mounting block, each one is independently calibrated for vertical and horizontal travel as well as depth.
Use of the chisels will add approximately 4 seconds to the overall cycle time. Chisels automatically switch between pocket sizes so simply selecting chisels on or off is all that�s required.
Option CR: Counter Rotating Routers The standard 994X relies on automatic chip-out blocks clamped between door and jamb to protect the door face and jamb edges from chipping during hinge routing. This option eliminates the chip-out blocks by adding four extra routers to the hinge detailing section with left hand rotation. As hinge pockets are routed, the left hand rotating routing tool is used to minimize chipping of the door face or jamb edge. This option is recommended for all applications including through cut hinge pockets, but cannot be combined with automatic hinge corner squaring (Option CH) due to space constraints imposed by hinge center distances.
Option E: Two-Stage Drilling Allows changeover for two different face bore sizes with a selection on the control panel.
Customer to specify 1-1/2� or 1-5/8� for dead bolt face bore when ordering. Standard lock boring bit is 2/1/8".
Option IL: Door Hand Indicator Light Light will be mounted on the out-feed end of the 990-F4 that can be seen by the 700-C Assembly Table operator. The light will be on when the door in the 990-F4 is being machined as a right hand door and off for a left hand door.
Option O: Door Blow-Off System Air blow-off tube cleans dust and chips from top of door as it feeds out of the 994-X.
Option R1: Zero & Three Degree Hinge Routing Price includes PLC logic and controls to allow front hinge routing section to rout on either a 0 degree or 3 degree angle. Hinges will be flush mounted when installed on doors with either square edge or 3 degree bevel on hinge side.
Option W: Hinge Stops for 6'8", 7'0" & 8'0" Doors This option is limited to certain hinge pocket locations. Hinge location specifications need to be submitted in order to determine if they can be accommodated with the 994-X.
Option Z: Screw-Changing Hopper for Six Shooter Screw-changing hopper for changing screw colors.
Modification for Future 6-Shooter & 8-Shooter Combination Option AG is required when a second hinge applicator is to be installed on the same machine at a future date. Price includes all components of Option AD plus new vertical frame parts and reinforced horizontal beams to support both the 6-Shooter and the 8-Shooter. Price also includes the necessary support for the two cable track systems to supply air and electric to both hinge applicators.
Pre-Drill Bits Kval will provide the customer with free pre-drill bits for the first two years of owning the equipment.

Contract ID:6466 Option C: Jamb Width Auto Selector Enables easy switching for jamb widths between 4-9/16 In, 5-1/4 In, 6-9/16 In, and 7-1/4 In.
Option D: 7 Ft and 8 Ft Door Frame Capacity Allows operator to quickly adjust end clamps from 6 Ft 8 In to 7 Ft or 8 Ft doors. Quick changeover time of approximately one minute required.
Tooling and Lubrication Package Please review with your KVAL consultant to determine your needs.

Contract ID:6466 Option F: Extra Jamb Index Stops Two extra jamb index stops for machining dead-bolt strikes.
Option H: Commercial Package Four additional stops for 6’8”, 7’0” and 8’0” jambs. (Stops included on base machine for 6/8 doors,does not include extra stops for deadlock machining)
Option O: High-Frequency Router 2HP high-frequency router motor with drive.
Option: Tooling and Lubrication Package Please review with your KVAL consultant to determine your needs.

Contract ID:6681 Option A: Reverse Stack In a pre-hanging operation this places the stack of doors on the operator side of a Commander or F-Series machine.
Option B: Reverse Feed Direction Re-orientates power buffer table rollers, drive and sensors to opposite hand.(This option is required only if the feed direction of the complete line is right to left.)
Option H: Remote Switch for Manual Feed Through Allows doors to be fed manually from the end of the machine. Price includes a non marking plastic roll mounted in the guard.
Option L: Ability to Feed Doors With Raised Molding This option adds the capacity to feed doors with raised molding on either or both sides. Maximum molding height above door face will be 3/4 inch. Spacers used to stack doors must be postioned so they do not interfere with the clamp system. The clamp system supports must be manually positioned to clear the molding prior to feeding the doors. The feed table will be equipped with additional rubber covered rolls closely spaced to support the door on the molding. NOTE: If ON-3 is used to feed a 555 Door Sizer Option R: Powered in-feed extension is required.
Option T: Extended Control Cable Extended Control Cable Extended cable length required when the 558 Door Sizer is included in the pre-hanging line so the control panel for the ON-3 can be mounted next to the door pre-hanging machine control panel. NOTE: This option is required when the 558 Door Sizer is installed between the ON-3 and the door pre-hanging machine.
Special Option: Joulin Vacuum Pad System Replaces the standard door end grip fixture with vacuum pump and Joulin lifting pads. Eliminates selector switch for wide or narrow doors, and lifts door widths from 12" to 48" including doors with proud mouldings protruding up to 3/4" above the door face. Minimum door stile width is 4-1/2". Maximum capacity for panel doors or doors with light cut-outs is 150lbs.
Special Option: Third Joulin Vacuum Pad Adds a third lifting pad centered between the pads described above. This increases lifting capacity to well over 200lbs and is recommended for heavy 2-1/4" stile and rail doors.

Contract ID:6681 Option R: Raised Moulding Infeed Width adjust powered extension mounted on the in-feed end of the 558. Provides the capacity to accommodate doors with raised molding. NOTE: Required when a Handler or ON-3 is used to feed doors with raised molding into the 558.
Special Option: Metal Door Sensor Adds a sensor at the machine in-feed to automatically detect a steel door face. Width will auto adjust to door bypass mode so door feeds through safely without contacting cutters or sander.
Special Option: 60mm Cutterhead: See note under additional details. This line will process 2-1/4" doors, requiring either a straight up and down 60mm cutter-head (no charge) or stacked cutter-heads and longer spindle (special charge to be quoted later).

Contract ID:6681 Option AR: Architectural Door Package Adds a barcode scanner and processing for architectural doors up 2-1/4” thick with Kval 2012 door software, which integrates with the machine’s industrial PC and CNC positioning motors to completely automate hinge pattern processing and lock locations. Door files can be created with the software which can reference barcode labels, or be selected from an on screen list for nearly instant machine set-up. The door files are identical to those used in the Kval Face, Edge and DLNC series machines so one file can be created to be used in multiple operations. Anti-Static air blow bar to clean door face is also included in this package.
Option FC: CNC Lock Face Plate with Chisels Adds CNC control of face plate routing and corner squaring of face plates on both ‘0’ and ‘3’ degree doors. Option includes programming and three additional servo motors, ball screws, servo drives and four corner square chisels. Operator can select face plates ranging in size from 1” to 1-1/4” wide and up to 2-3/4” long.
Option AC: Steel Door Sensor: Allows operator to do the edge prep on a steel door without accidently doing a face bore into the door.
Option ND1: Narrow Door Hinge Only Prep: Narrow Door System: Adds mechanism and programming for a narrow door mode to automatically accommodate doors as narrow as 1'0", but without lock processing. Includes complete secondary feed belt system on the lock detailing section of the 994X, and air cylinder adjustment of the lock side clamping fence with frame supports and rail bearings. Additional sensors and programming will be provided to confirm narrow width and to disable the standard door width sensors, and to disable the lock machining sequence. Narrow mode is selector switch controlled from the touch screen.
Special Option: Ball Catch Drills: Drill assemblies are mounted onto the lock boring section for drilling left hand and right hand doors for drive-in ball catches. When selected the proper drill automatically pivots in to drill into the top of the door. For typical 6'8", 7'0" and 8'0" doors the process will be fully automatic against the standard lock and hinge stops. Some special door lengths or lock locations may create a mechanical conflict between the drills and feed belt supports. This will be automatically detected to pause the machine cycle and a message will pop-up on the computer screen describing the problem. This allows the operator to use manual buttons to jog the door into a position for ball catch drilling in manual over-ride mode
Special Option: 5/4 jamb thickness: Machine will accommodate special thick jambs
Special Option: Double bore depth: Adds double bore capability with two different hole diameters for lock and dead-bolt holes. A two stage bit is used, typically a 1-5/8" diameter three wing boring bit with a 1/2" a shank. A larger multi-spur counter-bore bit is clamped above the three wing cutter. Drilling shallow or deep with a selection at the touch screen drills either hole diameter.

Contract ID:6681 Option C: Jamb Width Auto Selector Enables easy switching for jamb widths between 4-9/16 In, 5-1/4 In, 6-9/16 In, and 7-1/4 In.
Option D: 7 Ft and 8 Ft Door Frame Capacity Allows operator to quickly adjust end clamps from 6 Ft 8 In to 7 Ft or 8 Ft doors. Quick changeover time of approximately one minute required.
Option E: Dual Operator Controls Allows operator to run the machine from either side.
Option J: End Clamp Spacers For use on 6 Ft 6 In doors. Jamb spacer block connects to the end clamp pads. Four spacers required.
Special Option: 5/4 jamb thickness: Jamb fixtures to accommodate 5/4 thick jambs as well as rebated exterior jambs

Contract ID:6681 Option F: Extra Jamb Index Stops Two extra jamb index stops for machining dead-bolt strikes.
Option H: Commercial Package Four additional stops for 6’8”, 7’0” and 8’0” jambs. (Stops included on base machine for 6/8 doors,does not include extra stops for deadlock machining)
Option O: High-Frequency Router 2HP high-frequency router motor with drive.
Special Option: Turret adjust for exterior or interior jambs: Add a quick change adjustment for jamb type to compensate differences in registration of the jamb end.

Contract ID:6545 Customer will purchase a Machinery Service Contract Subscription ("Service Contract") from KVAL. The Service Contract will be in KVAL's standard form. Customer understands that unless it acquires the Subscription Contract, KVAL will not be able or obligated to service the machinery Canada. If Customer fails or refuses to enter the Service Contract, KVAL will have no obligation to service or replace the machinery or any of the Equipment, and will be released from all of its obligation to do so under the terms of the Canada Limited Warranty and After-Sales Service Agreement.

Option A: Reverse Stack In a pre-hanging operation this places the stack of doors on the operator side of a Commander or F-Series machine.
Option B: Reverse Feed Direction Reverses the feed direction of the powered roll table and changes the positions of the door sensing photo eyes. It is required when choosing Handler Option A for use with a standard feed (left to right) in a Commander or F-Series line.
Option H: Remote Switch for Manual Feed-Through Allows door to be fed manually from the end of the machine.

MachineInfo.Description: 994-X: SERVO CONTROLLED DOOR PRE HANGING MACHINE
MachineInfo.OrderComment:
Option A: Six-Shooter Screw Gun for 3-1/2" X 3-1/2" Hinge To attach 3-1/2" X 3-1/2" hinges to the door and jamb, No. 9 by 3/4" long flat head screws are automatically sorted and fed, six at a time, to the screw gun. Operator manually places the hinge onto the magnetic indexing fixture and then rolls and pivots the Six Shooter into an "H" block at each hinge location to attach the hinges. Pressing the 'Reset' switch then raises the Six Shooter and feeds a set of six screws for the attachment of the next hinge. NOTE: Requires Option D: Pre-Drill System for Six Shooter.
The Six Shooter, which is supported on ball bearing equipped steel wheels, is mounted on an overhead track that is precisely aligned to ensure the hinge is properly position into the pocket at each hinge location.
NOTE: When an Eight Shooter Screw Gun is added to a 990F-3 (or 990F-4) equipped with a Six Shooter, the overhead track system must be extended in length on both ends to provide the necessary clearance for hinge applicator being used to travel the full length of the track to attach the hinges without having to move the door and jamb.
Option BC: Ball Catch Drills Drill assemblies are mounted onto the lock boring section for drilling left hand and right hand doors for drive-in ball catches. When selected the proper drill automatically pivots in to drill into the top of the door. Note, minimum door width for drilling is 18".
Option CH: Corner Square Chisels Corner Square Option adds automatic corner squaring to the hinge routing sequence in both the door and jamb. Option includes two chisel mounting blocks per head, each one containing two chisels. As one chisel is operating, the inactive chisel is in the reveal between the door and jamb. For instance, when you are squaring the upper right corner in the jamb, the lower right chisel will be in the reveal. When the lower right chisel is squaring the lower right corner in the door, the upper right chisels in in the reveal. Although two chisels are paired together in one mounting block, each one is independently calibrated for vertical and horizontal travel as well as depth.
Use of the chisels will add approximately 4 seconds to the overall cycle time. Chisels automatically switch between pocket sizes so simply selecting chisels on or off is all that's required.
Option CR: Counter Rotating Routers The standard 994X relies on automatic chip-out blocks clamped between door and jamb to protect the door face and jamb edges from chipping during hinge routing. This option eliminates the chip-out blocks by adding four extra routers to the hinge detailing section with left hand rotation. As hinge pockets are routed, the left hand rotating routing tool is used to minimize chipping of the door face or jamb edge. This option is recommended for all applications including through cut hinge pockets, but cannot be combined with automatic hinge corner squaring (Option CH) due to space constraints imposed by hinge center distances.
Option IL: Door Hand Indicator Light Light will be mounted on the out-feed end of the 990-F4 that can be seen by the 700-C Assembly Table operator. The light will be on when the door in the 990-F4 is being machined as a right hand door and off for a left hand door.
Option ND1: Narrow Door Mode for 1'0" Doors Narrow Door System: Adds mechanism and programming for a narrow door mode to automatically accommodate doors as narrow as 1'0", but without lock processing. Includes complete secondary feed belt system on the lock detailing section of the 994X, and air cylinder adjustment of the lock side clamping fence with frame supports and rail bearings. Additional sensors and programming will be provided to confirm narrow width and to disable the standard door width sensors, and to disable the lock machining sequence. Narrow mode is selector switch controlled from the touch screen.
Option O: Door Blow-Off System Air blow-off tube cleans dust and chips from top of door as it feeds out of the 994-X.
Option W: Hinge Stops for 6'8", 7'0" & 8'0" Doors This option is limited to certain hinge pocket locations. Hinge location specifications need to be submitted in order to determine if they can be accommodated with the 994-X.
Option Z: Screw-Changing Hopper for Six Shooter Screw-changing hopper for changing screw colors.
Option R: Three Degree Bevel Machine will be fixed at 3 degree's.

Option C: Jamb Width Auto Selector Enables easy switching for jamb widths between 4-9/16 In, 5-1/4 In, 6-9/16 In, and 7-1/4 In.
Option D: 7 Ft and 8 Ft Door Frame Capacity Allows operator to quickly adjust end clamps from 6 Ft 8 In to 7 Ft or 8 Ft doors. Quick changeover time of approximately one minute required.
Option: Second Width Adjust Valve Place a secondary valve for width adjust control on opposite fence of operator.

Option W: Hinge Stops for 6'8", 7'0" & 8'0" Doors This option is limited to certain hinge pocket locations. Hinge location specifications need to be submitted in order to determine if they can be accommodated with the 994-X.
Add Second Six Screw Hopper Adds a second screw hopper next to the standard screw hopper above the six shooter screw gun. Both hoppers travel with the six shooter. A selector switch on the six screwdriver selects either hopper for instant screw color change.

Option C: Jamb Width Auto Selector Enables easy switching for jamb widths between 4-9/16 In, 5-1/4 In, 6-9/16 In, and 7-1/4 In.
Option D: 7 Ft and 8 Ft Door Frame Capacity Allows operator to quickly adjust end clamps from 6 Ft 8 In to 7 Ft or 8 Ft doors. Quick changeover time of approximately one minute required.

Option A: Split Jamb Stapler with Side Clamp Price does not include wide-crown staple guns.
Option H: Commercial Package Four additional stops for 6’8”, 7’0” and 8’0” jambs. (Stops included on base machine for 6/8 doors,does not include extra stops for deadlock machining)
Option O: High-Frequency Router 2HP high-frequency router motor with drive.

Option H: Remote Switch for Manual Feed-Through Allows door to be fed manually from the end of the machine.
Option L: Raised Molding Capability "Handler will accommodate doors with raised moldings up to 3/4"" high on one side or both sides. The Handler feed table will be revised to include rubber covered rolls on close centers to support the door on the molding. The clamp support pads will be increased in size and the standard rubber pads replaced with 1"" thick foam rubber. NOTE: If Handler is used to feed a 555 Door Sizer or 558 Door Sizer option R powered in-feed extension is required."
Option S: Short Boom Version This option makes a short boom version of the standard Handler Door Feeder. It will accommodate door stacks up to 65" high. Overall height of machine will be 95" from floor to top of the horizontal tube. Selection of this option deducts $2,000 off of the Handler's base price.
Option T: Extended Control Cable "Extended cable length required when the 555 Door Sizer or 558 Door Sizer is included in the pre-hanging line so the control panel for the Handler can be mounted next to the door pre-hanging machine control panel. NOTE: This option is required when the 555 Door Sizer or 558 Door Sizer is installed between the Handler and the door pre-hanging machine."
Mail Slot: 3'6" door slabs need to be manually fed through a mail slot.

Option B: Doors with Proud Mouldings Adds height adjustment to the infeed table with a servo motor, ball screw and bearing support system. Table height is programmable with touch screen selections for various moulding profiles, or a custom dimension can be entered. Maximum moulding height above (or below) door face is 3/4. A minimum 4 gap is required from the door edge to any protruding mouldings.

Option A: Door Frame Assembly Fixtures Adds indexing fixtures for manual attachment of the hinge jamb to the door and also adds cylinder operated door support fixtures at each corner of the machine to align sill, header and both leg jambs for frame assembly. Fixtures automatically compensate for 6'8", 7'0" & 8'0" door lengths. Also included are UHMW slides and rollers for out-swing door units.
Steel Door Frame Machine needs to allow assembly of inswing steel door frames and exit to MDA6 tilt up.
Option A: Door Clean-off with Air Nozzles Dual manifolds with air nozzles are mounted at out-feed end of DL-NCD to blow of face of the door as it exits.

Option B: Outswing Door Support Rollers and Delrin rails pivot up in seconds to transport inverted door frames from the light install station to the pivot table. Standard Acrobat requires outswings to be lifted and carried between stations.
Option HD: Hydraulic Pump and Tilt Cylinder Replaces the standard air cylinder tilt mechanism with a hydraulic pump and tilt cylinder operated with an two electric foot pedal for up and down. Much more heavy duty that the standard cylinder and required for 8'0" doors, or doors heavier than 100lbs including frame
Option D: 8' Door Capacity Note: Also requires Option HD be ordered at the same time to provide hydraulic tilt up system.
Option H: Fold-Down Sill Support Plate
Special Option: Hinge Jamb Staging Brackets & Door Clamp Adds brackets and clamps to make this station dual purpose: as both a tilt-up exit station (for outswings and 3'6" doors) or as a station to fasten hinge jambs to doors for standard inswings destined for the 700DC frame assembly station.

Option D1: 6'6" to 8'0" Moving Head End Head end clamp assemblies with staple guns will be mounted on linear bearing shafts. Each head end clamp assembly will have stops for 6'6", 6'8", 7'0" & 8'0" door units. The clamp assemblies will be held in position with pins that can be quickly removed without the aid of tools. Price includes the installation on the right side of the 700-DC (When viewed from the in-feed end) a third Forward/Reverse foot switch, a 'Fire' switch for in-feed end staple guns, and a 'Reset' switch.
Option E: 8-3/8" Wide Jamb Capacity 700-DC will accomodate jambs that vary in width from 4-9/16" to 8-3/8". Only the jamb width adjust fixtures will be modified to accomodate the 8-3/8" wide jambs. The staple gun travel assembly and the staple firing assembly will not be changed. If necessary an additional staple can be added at each corner of the 8-3/8" wide frame after it exits the 700-DC.
Special Features: Customer currently screws door frame together. Most frames are purchased with jamb ends predrilled for screws. Important that nailing patterns exist to place staples between holes.

Option HD: Hydraulic Pump and Tilt Cylinder Replaces the standard air cylinder tilt mechanism with a hydraulic pump and tilt cylinder operated with an two electric foot pedal for up and down. Much more heavy duty that the standard cylinder and required for 8'0" doors, or doors heavier than 100lbs including frame and glass.
Option D: 8' Door Capacity Note: Also requires Option HD be ordered at the same time to provide hydraulic tilt up system.

The second clamp assembly may be used to simultaneously clamp two side lights on either side of a single door unit up to 3'-0" wide. The second clamp may also be used with the primary clamp to install 3'-0" wide side light panels by pressing on both edges of the panel to properly seat it into the frame. The second side light clamp assembly will accommodate panels that vary in height from 6'-6" high to 8'-0" high.

Option D: Pre-Drill System for Six-Shooter Twenty-four holes are pre-drilled and hinge pockets are blown clean of any excess sawdust within five seconds following hinge pocket routing sequence for hinge screw mounting holes. This option is highly-recommended for all door and jamb materials.
Option G: Automatic Positioning Door is power-fed into the machine and clamped into position. After the hinges are attached, the door and jamb automatically off-feed as the next door enters the machine.

Two 1/4" crown staple guns are mounted onto the jamb clamp brackets. While clamped in the machine, staples will be driven into the back side of the split jamb to keep the male and female together. The staple guns are fired with a single valve that is interlocked with a safety switch to disable the staple guns unless there is a jamb clamped in the machine.
Two staple guns with remote fires are required and are not included in the price of the option.

Option E: Two-Stage Drilling Allows changeover for two different face bore sizes with a selection on the control panel.
Customer to specify 1-1/2" or 1-5/8" for dead bolt face bore when ordering. Standard lock boring bit is 2/1/8".
Option IL: Door Hand Indicator Light Light will be mounted on the out-feed end of the 990-F4 that can be seen by the 700-C Assembly Table operator. The light will be on when the door in the 990-F4 is being machined as a right hand door and off for a left hand door.
Option K: Eight-Shooter Screw Gun for 4" X 4" Hinge To attach 4" X 4" hinges to the door and jamb, No. 10 by 3/4" long flat head screws are automatically sorted and fed, eight (8) at a time, to the screw gun. Operator manually places the hinge onto the magnetic indexing fixture and then rolls and pivots the Eight Shooter into an "H" block at each hinge location to attach the hinges. Pressing the 'Reset' switch then raises the Eight Shooter and feeds a set of eight (8) screws for the attachment of the next hinge. NOTE: Requires Option K-1: Pre-Drill System for Eight Shooter.
NOTE: The Eight Shooter will not feed No. 9 flat head screws properly. If No. 9 screws are to be used in the Eight Shooter it must be specified at time of order.
The Eight Shooter, which is supported on ball bearing equipped steel wheels, is mounted on an overhead track that is precisely aligned to ensure the hinge is properly positioned into the pocket at each hinge location. NOTE: When an Eight Shooter Screw Gun is added to the 994-X or 993-X equipped with a Six Shooter, the overhead track system must be extended in length on both ends to provide the necessary clearance for each hinge applicator to travel the full length of the
Option ND1: Narrow Door Mode for 1'0" Doors Narrow Door System: Adds mechanism and programming for a narrow door mode to automatically accommodate doors as narrow as 1'0", but without lock processing. Includes complete secondary feed belt system on the lock detailing section of the 994X, and air cylinder adjustment of the lock side clamping fence with frame supports and rail bearings. Additional sensors and programming will be provided to confirm narrow width and to disable the standard door width sensors, and to disable the lock machining sequence. Narrow mode is selector switch controlled from the touch screen.
Option O: Door Blow-Off System Air blow-off tube cleans dust and chips from top of door as it feeds out of the 994-X.
Option R1: Zero & Three Degree Hinge Routing Price includes PLC logic and controls to allow front hinge routing section to rout on either a 0 degree or 3 degree angle. Hinges will be flush mounted when installed on doors with either square edge or 3 degree bevel on hinge side.
Option UH: Top Hinge Dimension Different for 6'-8" and 8'-0" Door In-feed door and jamb stops will be moveable. Door stop will be cylinder actuated. NOTE: Specifications for hinge locations must be provided in order to prepare quotation.
Option W: Hinge Stops for 6'8", 7'0" & 8'0" Doors This option is limited to certain hinge pocket locations. Hinge location specifications need to be submitted in order to determine if they can be accommodated with the 994-X.
Option Z: Screw-Changing Hopper for Six Shooter Screw-changing hopper for changing screw colors.
Option Z1: Quick-Change Hopper for Eight Shooter Screw changing hopper for 8-Shooter allows for rapid change of screw colors.
Option N: Weatherstrip Retaining Brackets

Option A: Duplex Edge Nailers Not recommended for MDF jambs. Guns not included in price.
Option C: Jamb Width Auto Selector Enables easy switching for jamb widths between 4-9/16 In, 5-1/4 In, 6-9/16 In, and 7-1/4 In.
Option D: 7 Ft and 8 Ft Door Frame Capacity Allows operator to quickly adjust end clamps from 6 Ft 8 In to 7 Ft or 8 Ft doors. Quick changeover time of approximately one minute required.
Special Option: 5/4 Jamb Thickness Machine must process both flat standard jambs and thick 5/4 jambs.

Option D: Point to Point Drill for Screw Holes Single 23,000 RPM three phase electric spindle drill. Programmed motion drills pilot holes in succession for hinge or lock face plate screws.
Option J: Corner Square Chisels Four chisels, one for each corner latch plate mortise and hinge pockets. The correct chisel is auto selected for each corner and the depth of the plunge is set based on the machined depth of the mortise. Please Note: Option P is also required for this option.
Option P: Upgrade To Patriot System This option upgrades the Edge Classic spindle support system to next generation called the Edge Patriot. Spindles are mounted vertically rather than horizontally and are supported on 25mm rail bearings. A key benefit is this version allows options for corner squaring and peck drilling for screw holes. 1234567 Option J: Corner Square Chisels

MachineInfo.Description: 994-X: SERVO CONTROLLED DOOR PRE HANGING MACHINE
MachineInfo.OrderComment:
Option A: Six-Shooter Screw Gun for 3-1/2" X 3-1/2" Hinge To attach 3-1/2" X 3-1/2" hinges to the door and jamb, No. 9 by 3/4" long flat head screws are automatically sorted and fed, six at a time, to the screw gun. Operator manually places the hinge onto the magnetic indexing fixture and then rolls and pivots the Six Shooter into an "H" block at each hinge location to attach the hinges. Pressing the 'Reset' switch then raises the Six Shooter and feeds a set of six screws for the attachment of the next hinge. NOTE: Requires Option D: Pre-Drill System for Six Shooter.
The Six Shooter, which is supported on ball bearing equipped steel wheels, is mounted on an overhead track that is precisely aligned to ensure the hinge is properly position into the pocket at each hinge location.
NOTE: When an Eight Shooter Screw Gun is added to a 990F-3 (or 990F-4) equipped with a Six Shooter, the overhead track system must be extended in length on both ends to provide the necessary clearance for hinge applicator being used to travel the full length of the track to attach the hinges without having to move the door and jamb.
Option BC: Ball Catch Drills Drill assemblies are mounted onto the lock boring section for drilling left hand and right hand doors for drive-in ball catches. When selected the proper drill automatically pivots in to drill into the top of the door. Note, minimum door width for drilling is 18".
Option CH: Corner Square Chisels Corner Square Option adds automatic corner squaring to the hinge routing sequence in both the door and jamb. Option includes two chisel mounting blocks per head, each one containing two chisels. As one chisel is operating, the inactive chisel is in the reveal between the door and jamb. For instance, when you are squaring the upper right corner in the jamb, the lower right chisel will be in the reveal. When the lower right chisel is squaring the lower right corner in the door, the upper right chisels in in the reveal. Although two chisels are paired together in one mounting block, each one is independently calibrated for vertical and horizontal travel as well as depth.
Use of the chisels will add approximately 4 seconds to the overall cycle time. Chisels automatically switch between pocket sizes so simply selecting chisels on or off is all that's required.
Option CR: Counter Rotating Routers The standard 994X relies on automatic chip-out blocks clamped between door and jamb to protect the door face and jamb edges from chipping during hinge routing. This option eliminates the chip-out blocks by adding four extra routers to the hinge detailing section with left hand rotation. As hinge pockets are routed, the left hand rotating routing tool is used to minimize chipping of the door face or jamb edge. This option is recommended for all applications including through cut hinge pockets, but cannot be combined with automatic hinge corner squaring (Option CH) due to space constraints imposed by hinge center distances.
Option O: Door Blow-Off System Air blow-off tube cleans dust and chips from top of door as it feeds out of the 994-X.
Option W: Hinge Stops for 6'8", 7'0" & 8'0" Doors This option is limited to certain hinge pocket locations. Hinge location specifications need to be submitted in order to determine if they can be accommodated with the 994-X.
Option Z: Screw-Changing Hopper for Six Shooter Screw-changing hopper for changing screw colors.
Pre-Wiring and Tank Mounts for future hinge applicator options Option is used on a 990F-3 sold without hinge applicator, and includes wiring and plumbing and valve banks, for installation of a Six or Eight- Shooter add-on at a later date.

Option D1: 6'6" to 8'0" Moving Head End Head end clamp assemblies with staple guns will be mounted on linear bearing shafts. Each head end clamp assembly will have stops for 6'6", 6'8", 7'0" & 8'0" door units. The clamp assemblies will be held in position with pins that can be quickly removed without the aid of tools. Price includes the installation on the right side of the 700-DC (When viewed from the in-feed end) a third Forward/Reverse foot switch, a 'Fire' switch for in-feed end staple guns, and a 'Reset' switch.

Option A: Adjustable Table for Doors with Proud Mouldings This option upgrades the standard castor bed in-feed table to include a highly accurate CNC servo motor and ball screw system to adjust table height in programmable increments with a touch screen. Multiple heights are pre-programmed and selected via touch screen buttons. Adjustment time is less than 5 seconds. This option also includes replacing every fifth row of castors with a full width steel roll with a urethane cover. The rolls are mounted 1/32” below the castor wheel height. The combination of castors and rolls makes it easy to manipulate panel doors or doors with proud mouldings on the castor bed, as well as doors with narrow stiles that might otherwise fall between the castor gaps. The adjustable height feature is also ideal for doors with door lights installed, or doors with mouldings protruding up to 1” above the door face, and provides a good solution when the PS-300 is used in combination with a 558 Door sizer since doors with proud mouldings can be fed at the correct infeed height.
Option H: Remote Switch for Manual Feed Through Allows doors to be fed manually from the end of the machine. Price includes a non marking plastic roll mounted in the guard.

Option IL: Door Hand Indicator Light Light will be mounted on the out-feed end of the 990-F4 that can be seen by the 700-C Assembly Table operator. The light will be on when the door in the 990-F4 is being machined as a right hand door and off for a left hand door.

NOTE: The Eight Shooter will not feed No. 9 flat head screws properly. If No. 9 screws are to be used in the Eight Shooter it must be specified at time of order.
